message_1: A spaceship travels towards a star at a speed of 0.9c. If the rest mass of the spaceship is 1000 kg, what is the relativistic mass of the spaceship?
message_2:
To find the relativistic mass of the spaceship, we can use the following formula:

m_rel = m_0 / sqrt(1 - v^2 / c^2)

where m_rel is the relativistic mass, m_0 is the rest mass, v is the velocity of the spaceship, and c is the speed of light.

Given the rest mass m_0 = 1000 kg and the velocity v = 0.9c, we can plug these values into the formula:

m_rel = 1000 kg / sqrt(1 - (0.9c)^2 / c^2)

m_rel = 1000 kg / sqrt(1 - 0.81)

m_rel = 1000 kg / sqrt(0.19)

m_rel ≈ 1000 kg / 0.43589

m_rel ≈ 2293.16 kg

The relativistic mass of the spaceship is approximately 2293.16 kg.
